001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.util.function.Function;
006
007import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
008
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
010import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheFlags;
011
012/**
013 * A JStachio Template is a renderer that has template meta data.
014 * <p>
015 * Generated code implements this interface.
016 * <p>
017 * While many of the methods allow passing in custom Escapers care must be taken to choose
018 * a proper escaper that supports the original media type and charset of the template.
019 * There is currently no runtime checking that the escaper supports the template's media
020 * type and charset.
021 *
022 * @author agentgt
023 * @param <T> the model type
024 */
025public interface Template<T> extends Renderer<T>, TemplateInfo {
026
027        /**
028         * Renders the passed in model.
029         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
030         * @param appendable the appendable to write to.
031         * @throws IOException if there is an error writing to the appendable
032         */
033        default void execute(T model, Appendable appendable) throws IOException {
034                execute(model, appendable, Formatter.of(templateFormatter()), Escaper.of(templateEscaper()));
035        }
036
037        /**
038         * Renders the passed in model.
039         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
040         * @param a appendable to write to.
041         * @param formatter formats variables before they are passed to the escaper
042         * @param escaper used to write escaped variables
043         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the appendable
044         */
045        public void execute(T model, //
046                        Appendable a, //
047                        Formatter formatter, //
048                        Escaper escaper) throws IOException;
049
050        /**
051         * Renders the passed in model.
052         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
053         * @param a appendable to write to.
054         * @param formatter formats variables before they are passed to the escaper
055         * @param escaper used to write escaped variables
056         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the appendable
057         */
058        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
059        default void execute(T model, //
060                        Appendable a, //
061                        Function<@Nullable Object, String> formatter, //
062                        Function<String, String> escaper) throws IOException {
063                execute(model, a, Formatter.of(formatter), Escaper.of(escaper));
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Return the model class (root context class annotated with JStache) that generated
068         * this template.
069         * @return model class
070         */
071        public Class<?> modelClass();
072
073        /**
074         * <strong>EXPERIMENTAL</strong> support of pre-encoded templates that have the static
075         * parts of the template already encoded into bytes. To generate templates that
076         * support this interface and are pre-encoded add {@link JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE}
077         * to the {@link JStacheFlags template flags}.
078         *
079         * <p>
080         * This interface is to support
081         * <a href="https://github.com/fizzed/rocker#near-zero-copy-rendering"> Rocker style
082         * near zero-copy rendering</a> where the static template parts are stored as byte
083         * arrays.
084         * <p>
085         * The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
086         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> thus an array or list of byte arrays
087         * can be accumulated to support almost zero-copy. <strong> Consequently absolutely no
088         * mutation of the byte arrays should happen as they could be reusable static parts of
089         * the template! </strong>
090         * <p>
091         * <em>Overall it is recommended that you do not use this interface unless you have an
092         * intimate knowledge of how your platform buffers data and have byte like access as
093         * current JMH benchmarking indicates that
094         * {@link String#getBytes(java.nio.charset.Charset)} is generally much faster for raw
095         * byte conversion albeit at the possible cost of increased memory. One should peform
096         * their own benchmarking to confirm using this interface is worth it. </em>
097         *
098         * @author agentgt
099         * @param <T> the model type
100         * @apiNote The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
101         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> and no mutation of the passed in
102         * byte array should happen downstream.
103         */
104        public interface EncodedTemplate<T> extends Template<T> {
105
106                /**
107                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
108                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
109                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
110                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
111                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
112                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
113                 * @param outputStream to write to.
114                 * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
115                 * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
116                 */
117                default void write(T model, //
118                                OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
119                        write(model, outputStream, Formatter.of(templateFormatter()), Escaper.of(templateEscaper()));
120                }
121
122                /**
123                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
124                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
125                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
126                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
127                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
128                 * <p>
129                 * For performance reasons the passed in escaper is not checked if it supports the
130                 * encoding so care must be taken to use an escaper that supports the static
131                 * {@link #templateCharset()}.
132                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
133                 * @param outputStream to write to.
134                 * @param formatter formats variables before they are passed to the escaper
135                 * @param escaper used to write escaped variables
136                 * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
137                 * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
138                 */
139                public void write(T model, //
140                                OutputStream outputStream, //
141                                Formatter formatter, //
142                                Escaper escaper) throws IOException;
143
144        }
145
146}
